title: Cruise Ship Terminology
description: Set sail with the specialized vocabulary of cruise ships and ocean voyages

questions.question: On a cruise ship, what does 'embarkation' mean?
options: The process of boarding the ship at the beginning of a cruise

questions.question: What is a 'stateroom' on a cruise ship?
options: A passenger cabin or private room aboard the ship

questions.question: In cruise terminology, what is a 'port of call'?
options: A type of wine served on board
A scheduled stop during the cruise where passengers can disembark and explore

questions.question: On a cruise ship, what does 'lido deck' refer to?
options: An open-air recreation area with swimming pools, sun loungers, and often a buffet

questions.question: What is a 'shore excursion' on a cruise?
options: Swimming from the ship to shore
An organized tour or activity at a port of call, often booked through the cruise line

questions.question: In cruise terminology, what does 'tender' refer to?
options: A small boat used to ferry passengers between the ship and shore when the ship cannot dock

questions.question: On a cruise ship, what is the 'bridge'?
options: The command center where the captain and officers navigate and control the ship

questions.question: What does 'muster drill' mean on a cruise ship?
options: A mandatory safety drill where passengers learn emergency procedures and lifeboat station locations

questions.question: In cruise terminology, what is a 'balcony cabin'?
options: A room near the balcony restaurant
A stateroom with a private outdoor area where guests can enjoy sea views

questions.question: What does 'debarkation' (or 'disembarkation') mean on a cruise?
options: A party on the last night
The process of leaving or exiting the ship at the end of the cruise or at a port

questions.question: On a cruise ship, what is 'sea day'?
options: The first day of the cruise
A day when the ship is at sea traveling between ports with no scheduled stops

questions.question: What is the 'galley' on a cruise ship?
options: The ship's kitchen where all meals are prepared

questions.question: In cruise language, what does 'aft' mean?
options: The rear or back end of the ship

questions.question: What is a 'repositioning cruise'?
options: A cruise that returns to the same port
A one-way voyage when a ship relocates between seasonal itineraries, often at discounted rates
A training cruise for new crew

questions.question: On a cruise ship, what does 'bow' refer to?
options: The forward-most part or front of the ship
